intro: Adenoropium hastatum, commonly known as the clustered goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has wiry, branched stems and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the leaves are typically gray-green with a fuzzy texture. Adenoropium hastatum is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
